means: 帮助( help的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The couple had helped in the hunt for the toddlers.
sentence.Network_cn: 这对夫妇曾帮着搜寻那些幼童。

sentence.Network_en: The scriptwriter helped him to adapt his novel for the screen.
sentence.Network_cn: 编剧帮助他将其所著小说改编成电影。

sentence.Network_en: Jane's goals helped Britain win third place in the Barcelona games.
sentence.Network_cn: 简的进球帮助英国队在巴塞罗那奥运会上获得了第三名。

PerfectNetExp.abs: They helped her into the ambulance ., 他们扶她上了救护车.
This was helped by a weak dollar , high prices and a rally in base metals ., 另外 , 美元的疲软 , 油价的居高不下 , 和贱金属的价格反弹都促使金价的飙升.

Connie helped him as much as she could . at first she was thrilled . he talked everything over with her monotonously , insistently , persistently , and she had to respond with all her might .康妮极力地帮助他。起初，她觉得很兴奋，他单调地、坚持地给她解说一切的事情，她得用全力去回答和了解。
Meddling by the army probably helped to bolster AK ' s ratings ., 军队的干涉反而可能助长了 AK 党的士气排名.

形容人性格的词汇 ... hearty 精神饱满的 helpful 助人的,有益的 helpless 无助的，没用的.

entry.def: If you help someone, you make it easier for them to do something, for example by doing part of the work for them or by giving them advice or money.

example.ex: He has helped to raise a lot of money...
example.tran: 他帮着筹集了很多钱。

example.ex: My mum used to help cook the meals for the children...
example.tran: 我妈妈过去常帮忙给孩子做饭。

entry.def: If you say that something helps, you mean that it makes something easier to do or get, or that it improves a situation to some extent.

example.ex: The right style of swimsuit can help to hide, minimise or emphasise what you want it to...
example.tran: 款式选择得当的泳装有助于按照意愿掩饰、缩小或突出某些部位。

example.ex: Building more motorways and bypasses will help the environment by reducing pollution and traffic jams in towns and cities...
example.tran: 建造更多的高速公路和绕城道路能够减少城镇中的污染和交通堵塞，有利于改善环境。

entry.def: If you help someone go somewhere or move in some way, you give them support so that they can move more easily.

example.ex: Martin helped Tanya over the rail...
example.tran: 马丁扶着塔尼娅越过栏杆。

example.ex: I allowed her to help me to my feet...
example.tran: 我允许她扶我站起来。

entry.def: If you help yourself, you try to get yourself out of a difficult situation rather than accept it and think you can do nothing to change it.

example.ex: He tries to help people with problems, but firmly believes they should do more to help themselves.
example.tran: 他尽力帮助有困难的人，但仍坚信他们应该更加努力自救。

entry.tran: 帮助解决困难的人（或事物）
entry.def: If you say that someone or something has been a help or has been some help, you mean that they have helped you to solve a problem.

example.ex: Thank you. You've been a great help already.
example.tran: 谢谢你。你已经帮了大忙了。

example.ex: ...a quality which will be a help rather than a hindrance to them...
example.tran: 会对他们有所助益而非阻碍的一种品质

entry.def: Help is action taken to rescue a person who is in danger. You shout 'help!' when you are in danger in order to attract someone's attention so that they can come and rescue you.

example.ex: He was screaming for help...
example.tran: 他高呼求救。

example.ex: 'Help!' I screamed, turning to run.
example.tran: “救命！”我尖叫道，转身就跑。

entry.def: In computing, help, or the help menu, is a file that gives you information and advice, for example about how to use a particular program.

example.ex: If you get stuck, click on Help.
example.tran: 如果碰到疑难，就点击“帮助”。

entry.def: If you help yourself to something, you serve yourself or you take it for yourself. If someone tells you to help yourself, they are telling you politely to serve yourself anything you want or to take anything you want.

example.ex: There's bread on the table. Help yourself...
example.tran: 桌上有面包。你自己拿吧。

example.ex: Just help yourself to leaflets.
example.tran: 请自取传单材料。

entry.def: If someone helps themselves to something, they steal it.

example.ex: Has somebody helped himself to some film star's diamonds?
example.tran: 有人偷了某个影星的钻石了吗？

entry.def: If you can't help the way you feel or behave, you cannot control it or stop it happening. You can also say that you can't help yourself .

example.ex: I can't help feeling sorry for the poor man...
example.tran: 我不禁为这个可怜的男人感到难过。

example.ex: 'Please don't cry.' — 'I can't help it.'...
example.tran: “别哭了。”——“我忍不住。”

entry.tran: （用于委婉地表示观点）不免，禁不住（想）
entry.def: If you say you can't help thinking something, you are expressing your opinion in an indirect way, often because you think it seems rude.

example.ex: I can't help feeling that this may just be another of her schemes...
example.tran: 我不免觉得这可能只是她的又一个诡计。

example.ex: I could not help but think this is a very queer life.
example.tran: 我忍不住会认为这是一种非常怪异的生活。

entry.def: If someone or something is of help, they make a situation easier or better.

example.ex: Can I be of help to you?
example.tran: 我能帮上你吗？

auth_sentence.content: I am short though, so that probably helped.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am short though, so that probably helped.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am short though, so that probably helped.

auth_sentence.content: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.
auth_sentence.res_content: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.

auth_sentence.content: That, analysts say, helped with his image.
auth_sentence.res_content: That, analysts say, helped with his image.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That, analysts say, helped with his image.

Sentence.sentence: He helped Doris build up the furniture.
Doris helped him arrange the furniture
Participation in this project helped the girls developed a new attitude towards their parents of their own homes; they've learned how to work with tools, and improve their work habits.
His writing and speaking raised the awareness of the importance of conservation and helped bring about our national park system.
Land Usage: Over the last five decades, improved farming techniques and technologies have helped to significantly increase crop yields along with a 12% expansion of farmed land use.
At first their church helped out, but you can't keep that up forever," Andrea says.
